titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School, MS 54.

history.provenance: Provenance: Inscr. ‘Henricus Salmon tunc possydet librum, teste Edmundo S. cum multis aliis quos nunc perscribere mora est’, 16th c.; inscr. ‘Mr Robarte Radclyff of Tybourne is the right possessor of this bocke, 16th c., ; Elizabeth Gressham, c. 1600; unidentified coat of arms; Edward Hailstone (d. 1890); Ridler; George Dunn.

listBibl.bibl: Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1033, no. 54; ELMUSA, p. 27; Nicholas Barker, ‘A Register of Writs and the Scales Binder’, The Book Collector 21:3 (Autumn 1972), p. 375.

body.p:
Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School
MS 54. Magna carta with statutes. 156 ff. 150 x 100 mm.
Provenance: Inscr. ‘Henricus Salmon tunc possydet librum, teste Edmundo S. cum multis aliis quos nunc perscribere mora est’, 16th c.; inscr. ‘Mr Robarte Radclyff of Tybourne is the right possessor of this bocke, 16th c., ; Elizabeth Gressham, c. 1600; unidentified coat of arms; Edward Hailstone (d. 1890); Ridler; George Dunn.
Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1033, no. 54; ELMUSA, p. 27; Nicholas Barker, ‘A Register of Writs and the Scales Binder’, The Book Collector 21:3 (Autumn 1972), p. 375.
